1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Content operators on types.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Cop.Type
6  ( -- * Operator
7    copsType,
8
9    -- * Implementation
10    -- ** Type conversion
11    copToDec,
12
13    -- ** Type test
14    -- *** Edge type
15    copIsEmpty, copIsEnd,
16    -- *** Simple type
17    copIsBool, copIsDec, copIsClock, copIsTime,
18    copIsCode, copIsTerm, copIsText,
19    -- *** Complex type
20    copIsList, copIsSet,
21    copIsTie, copIsRel, copIsInterp,
22    copIsType,
23  ) where
24
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture          as O
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data              as D
27import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base.Message  as Msg
28
29
30
31-- ----------------------
32-- $Operators
33--
34--  [@to-dec@]     Convert to decimal.
35--
36--  [@to-list@]    Convert to list.
37--
38--  [@to-set@]     Convert to set.
39--
40--  [@to-text@]    Convert to text.
41--
42
43-- | Content operators on types.
44copsType :: (D.CContent c) => [D.Cop c]
45copsType =
46    [ D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "to-dec")       copToDec
47    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "to-list")      copToList
48    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "to-set")       copToSet
49    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "to-text")      copToText
50
51    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "empty?")       copIsEmpty
52    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "bool?")        copIsBool
53    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "dec?")         copIsDec
54    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "clock?")       copIsClock
55    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "time?")        copIsTime
56    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "code?")        copIsCode
57    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "term?")        copIsTerm
58    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "text?")        copIsText
59    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "list?")        copIsList
60    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "set?")         copIsSet
61    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "tie?")         copIsTie
62    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "rel?")         copIsRel
63    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "interp?")      copIsInterp
64    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "type?")        copIsType
65    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "end?")         copIsEnd
66    ]
67
68-- ============================================  Conversion
69
70-- | Convert to decimal.
71--
72--   >>> to-dec "12.5"
73--   12.5
74--
75--   >>> to-dec "a"
76--   "a"
77--
78copToDec :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
79copToDec [Right c] = Right $ D.toDec c
80copToDec xs = Msg.badArg xs
81
82copToText :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
83copToText = op where
84    op [Right c] = Right $ D.pText $ D.contentString c
85    op xs = Msg.badArg xs
86
87copToList :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
88copToList = op where
89    op [Right c] | D.isSet c   = Right $ D.pList $ D.gSet c
90                 | otherwise   = Right c
91    op xs = Msg.badArg xs
92
93copToSet :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
94copToSet = op where
95    op [Right c] | D.isList c  = Right $ D.pSet $ D.gList c
96                 | otherwise   = Right c
97    op xs = Msg.badArg xs
98
99-- ============================================  Type test
100
101copTestType :: (D.CBool c) => O.Test c -> D.CopCalc c
102copTestType test [Right c] | test c  = D.putTrue
103copTestType _ _                      = D.putFalse
104
105-- | Test content is the empty.
106--
107--   >>> empty? ()
108--   (+)
109--
110--   >>> empty? "a"
111--   (-)
112--
113copIsEmpty :: (D.CBool c, D.CEmpty c) => D.CopCalc c
114copIsEmpty = copTestType D.isEmpty
115
116-- | Test content is the end.
117--
118--   >>> end? (/)
119--   (+)
120--
121--   >>> end? "a"
122--   (-)
123--
124copIsEnd :: (D.CBool c, D.CEnd c) => D.CopCalc c
125copIsEnd = copTestType D.isEnd
126
127-- | Test content is a boolean.
128--
129--   >>> bool? (+)
130--   (+)
131--
132--   >>> bool? "a"
133--   (-)
134--
135copIsBool :: (D.CBool c) => D.CopCalc c
136copIsBool = copTestType D.isBool
137
138-- | Test content is a decimal number.
139--
140--   >>> dec? 12.5
141--   (+)
142--
143--   >>> dec? "a"
144--   (-)
145--
146copIsDec :: (D.CBool c, D.CDec c) => D.CopCalc c
147copIsDec = copTestType D.isDec
148
149-- | Test content is a clock.
150--
151--   >>> clock? |12:00|
152--   (+)
153--
154--   >>> clock? "a"
155--   (-)
156--
157copIsClock :: (D.CBool c, D.CClock c) => D.CopCalc c
158copIsClock = copTestType D.isClock
159
160-- | Test content is a time.
161--
162--   >>> time? 2013-04-18
163--   (+)
164--
165--   >>> time? "a"
166--   (-)
167--
168copIsTime :: (D.CBool c, D.CTime c) => D.CopCalc c
169copIsTime = copTestType D.isTime
170
171-- | Test content is a code.
172--
173--   >>> code? 'a
174--   (+)
175--
176--   >>> code? "a"
177--   (-)
178--
179copIsCode :: (D.CBool c, D.CCode c) => D.CopCalc c
180copIsCode = copTestType D.isCode
181
182-- | Test content is a term name.
183--
184--   >>> term? '/a
185--   (+)
186--
187--   >>> term? "a"
188--   (-)
189--
190copIsTerm :: (D.CBool c, D.CTerm c) => D.CopCalc c
191copIsTerm = copTestType D.isTerm
192
193-- | Test content is a text.
194--
195--   >>> text? 12.5
196--   (-)
197--
198--   >>> text? "a"
199--   (+)
200--
201copIsText :: (D.CBool c, D.CText c) => D.CopCalc c
202copIsText = copTestType D.isText
203
204-- | Test content is a list.
205--
206--   >>> list? [ 0 | 1 ]
207--   (+)
208--
209--   >>> list? "a"
210--   (-)
211--
212copIsList :: (D.CBool c, D.CList c) => D.CopCalc c
213copIsList = copTestType D.isList
214
215-- | Test content is a set.
216--
217--   >>> set? { 0 | 1 }
218--   (+)
219--
220--   >>> set? "a"
221--   (-)
222--
223copIsSet :: (D.CBool c, D.CSet c) => D.CopCalc c
224copIsSet = copTestType D.isSet
225
226-- | Test content is a tie.
227--
228--   >>> tie? {- /a 0 /b 1 -}
229--   (+)
230--
231--   >>> tie? "a"
232--   (-)
233--
234copIsTie :: (D.CBool c, D.CTie c) => D.CopCalc c
235copIsTie = copTestType D.isTie
236
237-- | Test content is a rel.
238--
239--   >>> rel? {= /a /b [ 0 | 1 ] =}
240--   (+)
241--
242--   >>> rel? "a"
243--   (-)
244--
245copIsRel :: (D.CBool c, D.CRel c) => D.CopCalc c
246copIsRel = copTestType D.isRel
247
248-- | Test content is a interp.
249--
250--   >>> interp? {| /x is equal to /y . |}
251--   (+)
252--
253--   >>> interp? "a"
254--   (-)
255--
256copIsInterp :: (D.CBool c, D.CInterp c) => D.CopCalc c
257copIsInterp = copTestType D.isInterp
258
259-- | Test content is a type.
260--
261--   >>> type? [- text -]
262--   (+)
263--
264--   >>> type? "a"
265--   (-)
266--
267copIsType :: (D.CBool c, D.CType c) => D.CopCalc c
268copIsType = copTestType D.isType
269
